alert.note: Alert for Elbert (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 17 at 4:57PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR LOW LYING AREAS, AND CREEKS AND STREAMS IN NORTHEAST ELBERT COUNTY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of east central Colorado, including the following county, Elbert. * WHEN...Until 900 AM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 455 PM MDT, Elbert County Public Works reported flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Muddy Creek, Agate Creek, Big Sandy Creek, East Bijou Creek and Beaver Creek. - Northeast Elbert County
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
